HEATH CITY COUNCIL
------------------

SERVING OUR COMMUNITY

> The Heath City Council consists of a Mayor and six Council Members who are elected at large. Click an image to email the Mayor or a Council Member.

![JEREMIAH McCLURE](https://www.heathtx.com/wp-content/uploads/JeremyMclure2.jpg)

mailto:jmcclure@heathtx.com

### JEREMIAH McCLURE

MAYOR

Serving Since May 2024

City of Heath, TX

### CITY COUNCIL MEETINGS

> The City of Heath Council meet the second and fourth Tuesday of each month. Meetings occur in the Council Chambers at Heath City Hall, 200 Laurence Drive and typically begin at 6:30pm. Residents are encouraged to attend.

![SCOTT DODSON](https://www.heathtx.com/wp-content/uploads/ScottDodson.jpg)

mailto:sdodson@heathtx.com

BOARDS & COMMISSIONS
--------------------

PLANNING & ZONING COMMISSION

***–** meets 1st Tuesday at 6:30 pm*

James Tunnell, Chairman  
Wayne Gordon, Vice-Chairman  
Thomas Bishop  
Harry Heinkele  
Mike Rask  
Joe Ruszkiewicz  
Bob Shaw

The Planning & Zoning Commission reviews and makes recommendations on land use and development issues. Their work helps shape the future of a community by guiding development to reflect the values of its residents.

PARK BOARD

*– meets 3rd Monday at 6:00 pm*

Justin Holland, Chairman  
John Walker, Vice-Chairman  
Bill Bromley  
David Vega  
Ben Fields  
Tom Herceg  
Joe Rubertino

The Park Board adopts and sets bylaws and establishes policies and procedures for proper administration of the parks and recreation program of the City subject to the approval of the City Council.

HEDC & HMBC

*– meets 3rd Tuesday at 5:30 pm*

Mike Zilinskas, Vice – Chairman  
Glen Hettinger  
Douglas Barkley  
Myles Hunter  
Richard Koepke  
David Lane  
Jeff Anderson  
Jeremiah McClure, ex-officio

The Heath EDC/MBC are nonprofit organizations that help new and existing businesses, and assists with workforce development. The organizations are funded by sales taxes approved by City voters.

SPECIAL EVENTS BOARD

*– meets 4th Monday at 7:00 pm*

Tami Hogan  
Jenni Knox  
Amanda Rosander  
Sandra Ownby  
Karen Myers

The Special Events Board is responsible for planning, funding, logistics, and execution of all City events. This includes annual citywide celebrations, ground breaking, grand openings and other one-of-a-kind events.

ARCHITECTURAL REVIEW BOARD

– meets monthly

Jason Thompson, Chairman  
Greg Ramey  
SuzAnne Howland  
Thomas Smith  
Douglas Hartman  
Richard Anderson  
Robert Farquharson  
Harriet Anderson, Alternate  
Lisa Reeves, Alternate

The ARB sets, reviews, and recommends architectural standards and policies to ensure that architectural development decisions align with community goals and technical standards.

BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT

*– meets ad hoc*

Christopher Boeck, Chairman  
Eric Harless  
Nathan Goodnight  
Phillip Hatfield  
Jimmy Lipinski  
Ira Berger, Alternate  
Dalton Tassett, Alternate  
James Sax, Alternate  
Joshua Small, Alternate

The Board of Adjustment is a quasi-judicial body that hears requests for variances to a City’s zoning ordinance and makes recommendations to City Council.

TAKE AREA APPEALS PANEL

*– meets ad hoc*

Joan Marshall  
Karen Koepke  
Joshua Small  
Lynn Tran  
Bart Davenport

The Take Area Appeals Panel review and decide on appeals related to regulatory matters within the Lake Ray Hubbard shoreline and make recommendations to City Council.

CLUB MUNICIPAL MGMT. DISTRICT No. 1

*– meets ad hoc*

Mark Kennedy, President  
Norman Grunsfeld, Vice President  
James E. Sax, Secretary  
Leon Schieber, Assistant Secretary  
Alexis M. Lucas, Assistant Secretary  
Cody Baker, Ex-officio  
Mark Gonzales, Ex-officio

The Club Municipal Management District No. 1 is a special purpose district created by an act of the 82nd Texas legislature in 2011 and is governed by a five member board of directors for Heath Golf and Yacht Club.

FINANCE BOARD

*– meets ad hoc*

Brian Berry  
Justin Saunders  
Don Burrows  
Chris Shaw  
Eric Stacey  
Robert Swayze  
John Kenny

*Positions Updated 08/01/25*
